Thank you for the input. I'll have to look into the format of the arc.gz fi=
les. My concern at this point is how Heritrix handles Javascript. I guess I=
 don't need to run the javascript, I just have to read it, search for vario=
us text strings; document.write, encode, etc. then analyze the javascript f=
urther. I've been testing my concept just using a wget script then running =
some of my various perl scripts against the downloads and found one site th=
at had numerous files with a ".php" extension but the file was actually a W=
indows executable. I haven't run the file yet but why someone would do that=
 is definitely suspicious.

In an ideal world, the Chicago Cubs would win the World Series, (only kidd=
ing) and I would be able to script the file being passed to a system runnin=
g VMware and have the file executed and tested.=20

I know, I'm only dreaming...

Thomas J. Raef
e-Based Security, Inc.
"You're either hardened, or you're hacked!"=20

-------- Original Message --------
> From: "joehung302" <joe.hung@...>
> Sent: Friday, June 16, 2006 10:32 PM
> To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [archive-crawler] Re: Are there any Heritrix consultants out th=
ere?
>=20
> Assume there are virus/spyware/malware out there in the web pages.
> Here is how I would do it using Heritrix.
>=20
> - Crawl sites and collect web pages.
> - Heritrix will put crawled content in the "arc.gz" format.
> - You'll probably get thousands of arc.gz files depending on how much
> you crawl.
> - Once the crawling is done, Use the arc reader library to write you
> own "page visitor", analyze whatever you want.
>=20
> cheers,
> -joe
>=20
> --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "Thomas Raef" <traef06@...> wrot=
e:
> >
> > While I do try to participate by giving and receiving in lists like
> > this, I feel that being such a newbie with Heritrix I would only be on
> > the receiving end and having nothing to give. That is why I decided to
> > find a consultant.
> >=20
> > At this point my questions are very broad. I would like to archive lis=
ts
> > of websites and then scan them for viruses/spyware/malware stuff.
> > Anything found would be added to a blacklist to be shared with various
> > security based newsgroups.
> >=20
> > There is also certain javascript code segments I want to find and when=
 I
> > do find them, I would like a list of those sites so I can investigate
> > them further.
> >=20
> > Is this possible with Heritrix? Is anyone doing this now?=20
> >=20
> > I read about how the University of Washington did their research but i=
t
> > doesn't provide enough details on exactly how their system was
> > setup/configured. I would like to do something like what they did/are
> > doing, but on an ongoing basis and actually provide lists to various
> > security groups as well as using it myself.
> >=20
> > Is this something the list can assist me with? Or should I keep lookin=
g
> > for consulting help?
> >=20
> > Please let me know.
> >=20
> > Thank you in advance for your consideration.
> >=20
